thread.title: Ivanka Trump takes in Broadway show with Justin Trudeau
thread.title_full: Ivanka Trump takes in Broadway show with Justin Trudeau

author: KATE FELDMAN
title: Ivanka Trump takes in Broadway show with Justin Trudeau
text:
Ivanka Trump takes in Broadway show with Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau Ivanka Trump takes in Broadway show with Justin Trudeau Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau and Ivanka Trump, shown here in February, were spotted together at the Broadway show “Come From Away” Wednesday night. (Evan Vucci/AP) Wednesday, March 15, 2017, 8:56 PM 
Ivanka Trump had Justin Trudeau on her arm at a Broadway show about embracing strangers. 
The First Daughter took in “Come From Away” with the Canadian prime minister Wednesday night, according to the New York Times . 
Trudeau had previously announced that he'd be in attendance with his wife. 
Nikki Haley, the U.S. Ambassador to the United Nations, was also with the group. 
Trump says buy American, but Ivanka's fashion line made in China 
“Come From Away,” with book, music and lyrics by Canadian husband-and-wife team Irene Sankoff and David Hein, begins a week after the Sept. 11 attacks and tells the true story of a group of 6,579 people on 38 planes forced to land unexpectedly in Gander, Newfoundland and how the local residents embrace their new neighbors. 
The musical had successful runs in Ontario, San Diego, Seattle and Washington, D.C., before opening on Broadway on March 12 at the Gerald Schoenfeld Theatre. 
“Come From Away,” directed by Tony nominee Christopher Ashley, stars Petrina Bromley, Geno Carr, Jenn Colella, Joel Hatch, Rodney Hicks, Kendra Kassebaum, Chad Kimball, Lee MacDougall, Caesar Samayoa, Q. Smith, Astrid Van Wieren and Sharon Wheatley. “Come From Away” begins a week after the Sept. 11 attacks and tells the true story of a group of 6,579 people on 38 planes forced to land unexpectedly in Gander, Newfoundland and how the local residents embrace their new neighbors. (Broadway.com) 
Trudeau spoke to the audience before the show Wednesday night and thanked the cast, who “worked to pull together such an extraordinary crowd to celebrate this story of friendship during extraordinarily difficult times between individuals between countries.” 
‘Come From Away’ on Broadway — theater review 
The Prime Minister also spoke about “the close relationship between the United States and Canada.” 
“The world gets to see what it is to lean on each other and be there for each other,” he said. 
Trudeau and Trump had previously met during a roundtable discussion about women in the workforce in February. 
Press reps for the show told the Daily News that the Canadian Consulates had arranged a block of tickets, but that they were unaware of the guest list. Tags:
